metadata.title: CVE-2024-1554 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The `fetch()` API and navigation incorrectly shared the same cache, as thecache key did not include the optional headers `fetch()` may contain.Under the correct circumstances, an attacker may have been able to poisonthe local browser cache by priming it with a `fetch()` response controlledby the additional headers. Upon navigation to the same URL, the user wouldsee the cached response instead of the expected response. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-1554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
